knimeNode.name: Feature Selection Loop Start (1:1)
knimeNode.shortDescription: Start node for a feature selection loop

fullDescription.intro: This node is the start of the feature selection loop. The feature selection loop allows you to select, from all the features in the input data set, the subset of features that is best for model construction. With this node you determine (i) which features/columns are to be held fixed in the selection process. These constant or "static" features/columns are included in each loop iteration and are exempt from elimination; (ii) which selection strategy is to be used on the other (variable) features/columns and its settings; and (iii) at which threshold number of variable features the selection process is to terminate.

tab.name: General Settings
tab.option: Columns can be selected manually or by means of regular expressions. The columns in the left pane are the static columns, those in the right pane the variable columns. Since a feature selection process always has a target feature and a set of features to select from, there will always be at least one static column and more than one variable column. If you leave the left pane empty and run the node, you will get a warning. Columns can be moved from one pane to the other by clicking on the appropriate button in the middle.
Here you can choose between the selection strategies: Forward Feature Selection, Backward Feature Elimination, and Genetic Algorithm .

option.name: Use threshold for number of features

tab.option: Check this option if you want to set a bound for the number of selected features. Since Forward Feature Selection adds features while Backward Feature Elimination subtracts them, this will be an upper bound for Forward Feature Selection and a lower bound for Backward Feature Elimination. For Genetic Feature Selection it will be an upper bound, but while the genetic algorithm tries its best ensuring that this bound is not exceeded, it cannot ensure this.

option.name: Select threshold for number of features

tab.option: Set the upper or lower bound for the number of selected features.

tab.name: Genetic Algorithm
tab.option: Defines the number of individuals in each population.
Defines the number of generations. The upper bound of number of iterations is Population size * Number of generations ,but usually less are needed.
Defines the strategy to use for the selection of offspring .
Defines the strategy to use for crossover .
Defines the crossover rate used to alter offspring.
Defines the mutation rate used to alter offspring.
Defines the rate of how many of the best individuals of a generation are transfered to the next generation without alteration.
Choose a seed to get reproducible results.
